questiontext.text:
Exercise

Given 2 sets \(A, B\) and a universal set \(S\), recall that the complement of \(A\) is denoted by \(A'\) and the complement of \(B\) is denoted by \(B'\). Which of the following statements are true?

generalfeedback.text: To see that these 2 statements are true, use definitions of complement, union, intersection. Alternatively, draw Venn diagrams representing the sets in question.
